title: AMU Admission 2024: UG, PG, Courses, Eligibility, Entrance Exam, Application Form, Last Date
meta_description: Aligarh Muslim University - [AMU], Aligarh, Uttar Pradesh. Admission News for

AMU UG Admission 2024.Eligibility: 10+2 Examination or an equivalent Examination with not less than 50% marks in aggregate
AMU UG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria:
Based on the Admission Test conducted by AMU
			For BA {Hons.} in Hindi, Sanskrit, Persian, Philosophy, the admissions are based on CUET UG conducted by NTA

AMU UG Admission 2024.Eligibility: 10+2 in Agriculture or in Science (With Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics / Biology / Home Science) or an equivalent examination with 50% marks in aggregate
AMU UG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria:
Based on the Admission Test conducted by AMU.
			For BSc {Hons.} in community science, the admissions are based on CUET UG conducted by NTA

AMU UG Admission 2024.Eligibility: 10+2 Examination or an equivalent examination with at least 50% marks in aggregate with English and one of the following subjects Accountancy / Economics / Business Studies / Commerce / Banking / Entrepreneurship / Mathematics / Computer Science / Business Administration / Financial Markets Management
AMU UG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on the Admission Test conducted by AMU

AMU UG Admission 2024.Eligibility: 10+2 Examination with Physics, Chemistry & Mathematics of this University or an equivalent examination with at least 45% marks in aggregate
AMU UG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on CUET UG conducted by NTA

AMU UG Admission 2024.Eligibility: 10+2 or an equivalent examination with aggregate not less than 50% of the total marks
AMU UG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on the Departmental Test conducted by AMU

AMU UG Admission 2024.Eligibility: Minimum 50% marks in B.A. / B.Sc. / B. Com. / B.Th. in aggregate and in the subject concerned or Minimum 55% marks in the Master’s Degree in Science / Social Sciences / Humanities, Bachelor in Engineering & Technology with specialization in Science and Mathematics
AMU UG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on the Admission Test conducted by AMU

AMU UG Admission 2024.Eligibility: Bachelor’s degree in any discipline with 50% marks and having at least participation in the InterCollege/Inter Zonal / District / School competition in sports and games as recognized by the AIU / IOA / SGFI / Govt. of India. OR Bachelor’s Degree in Physical Education with 45% marks OR Bachelor’s degree in any discipline with 45% marks and studied physical education as compulsory elective subject
AMU UG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on the Admission Test conducted by AMU

AMU UG Admission 2024.Eligibility: 10+2 with at least 50% marks in aggregate of English, Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics
AMU UG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on scores of the Admission Test conducted by AMU

AMU UG Admission 2024.Eligibility: Diploma in Engg. in the relevant branch of study or an examination recognised by the University as its equivalent with 50% marks
AMU UG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on scores of the Admission Test conducted by AMU

AMU UG Admission 2024.Eligibility: 10+2 Exam or an equivalent examination with at least 50% marks in aggregate of English, Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics
AMU UG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on scores of the Admission Test conducted by AMU. Candidates are also required to qualify the NATA exam to be eligible for admission

AMU UG Admission 2024.Eligibility: 10+2 examination with Physics, Chemistry, Biology and English. Further, the candidate must have obtained a minimum of 50% marks in aggregate in Physics, Chemistry and Biology.
AMU UG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on NEET UG scores and counseling

AMU UG Admission 2024.Eligibility: 10+2 examination with Physics, Chemistry, Biology and English. Further, the candidate must have obtained a minimum of 50% marks in aggregate in Physics, Chemistry and Biology
AMU UG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on NEET UG scores and counseling

AMU PG Admission 2024.Eligibility: B.A./ BCom./ BSc. or equivalent examination with at least 50% marks in the relevant subject
AMU PG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on the Departmental test Conducted by AMU

AMU PG Admission 2024.Eligibility: B.Sc. in the relevant branch of study with Minimum 55% marks in aggregate
AMU PG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on the Departmental test Conducted by AMU

AMU PG Admission 2024.Eligibility: B.Com. (Hons.) with minimum 55% marks in aggregate
AMU PG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on the Departmental test Conducted by AMU

AMU PG Admission 2024.Eligibility: LL.B./B.A.LL.B. degree from a recognized University with not less than 55% marks
AMU PG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on the Admission Test conducted by AMU

AMU PG Admission 2024.Eligibility: Bachelor's degree in any discipline with at least 50% marks in aggregate
AMU PG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on the AMU Admission Test

AMU PG Admission 2024.Eligibility: B.Ed. degree or an equivalent degree with at least 50% marks in aggregate of theory papers
AMU PG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on the Departmental test Conducted by AMU

AMU PG Admission 2024.Eligibility: B.Tech. or its equivalent examination in the relevant branch of study with not less than 60% marks in aggregate or its equivalent CPI/CGPA/NAG
AMU PG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on the Departmental test Conducted by AMU/GATE scores

AMU PG Admission 2024.Eligibility: MBBS degree from a recognized University
AMU PG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on NEET PG scores and counseling

AMU PG Admission 2024.Eligibility: BDS degree from a recognised University
AMU PG Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on NEET PG scores and counseling

AMU Ph.D. Admission 2024.Selection Criteria: Based on the Written Test (80 marks) followed by Presentation/ Interview (30 marks) conducted by AMU

faqs.question: Do I have to register multiple times to apply for different courses at AMU?
faqs.answer: Ans.No, you don’t have to register yourself multiple times. Only Single Registration is sufficient for a candidate to apply for the multiple courses at AMU.

faqs.question: What are the required formats required while filling up the application form at AMU?
faqs.answer: Ans.As per the AMU guidelines, the format of a scanned copy of a colored Photo with white background, Signature, and Thumb Impression (Left Hand Thumb Impression) must be in JPG/JPEG format only. The file size of each should be between 20KB to 100KB

faqs.question: What factors can lead to the rejection of an application form of AMU?
faqs.answer: Ans.The application of AMU may be rejected due to the following factors:The candidate has submitted an incomplete application form.Not submitted the prescribed form.Not paying the application form fee.Submission of application form after the last date.

faqs.question: Can a student pursue two regular degrees at one time from AMU?
faqs.answer: Ans.No, AMU does not allow two regular degree programs at the same time. However, a student can pursue two programs simultaneously through distance mode or combination of distance and regular modes from the same or different Universities / Institutions in various combinations like :One degree and one Diploma / PG Diploma / Certificate courseOne Post Graduate Diploma and One Diploma / Certificate courseOne Diploma and one Certificate courseTwo PG Diploma CoursesTwo Diploma CoursesTwo Certificate courses.

faqs.question: Does AMU provide any compensation in fee to the students with any Pwd (Persons with Disability)?
faqs.answer: Ans.The candidates with a disability will be exempted by AMU from the payment of the following Fee / Charges:Admission Charges (Tuition Fee) / Test Fee / Processing ChargesExamination Fee

faqs.question: What is the maximum age limit for a candidate to apply for any UG course at AMU?
faqs.answer: Ans.As per AMU guidelines, a candidate for more than 24 years as of 01st July in the year of admission is not allowed to apply for any UG course.

faqs.question: What are the main subject courses available under B.A.(Hons.) at AMU?
faqs.answer: Ans.The following are the main subject courses available under B.A.(Hons.) at AMU:ArabicCommunicative EnglishEnglishHindiGeographyLinguisticsPersianPhilosophyQuranic StudiesSanskritUrdu

faqs.question: Will the gap in academics affect my admission to AMU?
faqs.answer: Ans.No, your admission to AMU will not be affected if you have a gap in your academics. Candidates who want to seek admission with a gap have to submit an affidavit stating that the candidate was not involved in any criminal activity and state the reason for the gap.

faqs.question: Does AMU provide any hostel facility?
faqs.answer: Ans.Yes, hostel facilities are provided to students at AMU on a first-come-first-serve basis. There are 19 Halls of Residence and one Non-Resident Students Centre (NRSC). 13 Halls of Residence for boys and 6 for Girls.

faqs.question: Does AMU charge any additional fee for professional courses?
faqs.answer: Ans.All professional courses at AMU are self-financed. The admitted students are required to pay a self-finance fee of Rs. 20,000 per year in two installments: Rs. 10,000 at the time of completion of admission in next/second year (as applicable) and Rs. 10,000 in January after continuation of admission in next/second year.
